user_question: How can I capture the Milky Way in a photograph and generate an image of a starry night sky?
final_answer: To capture the Milky Way, use a wide-angle lens, set your camera to manual mode, use a high ISO (1600-3200), a wide aperture (f/2.8 or lower), and a shutter speed of 20-30 seconds. Image of a starry night sky generated. The best time to photograph the Milky Way is from April to September, during a new moon and away from light pollution.
